verses.kjv: Is there not an appointed time to man upon earth? are not his days also like the days of an hireling?
verses.ct: Isn't human life on earth like forced labor? Aren't our days like those of a hired worker?

verses.kjv: As a servant earnestly desireth the shadow, and as an hireling looketh for the reward of his work:
verses.ct: Like a slave longing for shade, or a laborer waiting for his paycheck,

verses.kjv: So am I made to possess months of vanity, and wearisome nights are appointed to me.
verses.ct: that's how I've been given months of emptiness, and nights of misery have been assigned to me.

verses.kjv: When I lie down, I say, When shall I arise, and the night be gone? and I am full of tossings to and fro unto the dawning of the day.
verses.ct: When I go to bed, I think, 'When will morning come?' But the night drags on, and I toss and turn until dawn.

verses.kjv: My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust; my skin is broken, and become loathsome.
verses.ct: My body is covered with maggots and crusted dirt; my skin cracks open and oozes.

verses.kjv: My days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle, and are spent without hope.
verses.ct: My days pass faster than a weaver's shuttle, and they end without any hope.

verses.kjv: O remember that my life is wind: mine eye shall no more see good.
verses.ct: Remember, God, that my life is just a breath — my eyes will never again see anything good.

verses.kjv: The eye of him that hath seen me shall see me no more: thine eyes are upon me, and I am not.
verses.ct: Those who see me now will never see me again; your eyes will look for me, but I'll be gone.

verses.kjv: As the cloud is consumed and vanisheth away: so he that goeth down to the grave shall come up no more.
verses.ct: Like a cloud that fades and disappears, the person who goes down to the grave never comes back up.

verses.kjv: He shall return no more to his house, neither shall his place know him any more.
verses.ct: He never returns to his home again, and the place where he lived won't even recognize him.

verses.kjv: Therefore I will not refrain my mouth; I will speak in the anguish of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.
verses.ct: So I refuse to keep quiet. I will speak out of the anguish of my spirit; I will pour out the bitterness of my soul.

verses.kjv: Am I a sea, or a whale, that thou settest a watch over me?
verses.ct: Am I the sea, or some sea monster, that you post a guard over me?

verses.kjv: When I say, My bed shall comfort me, my couch shall ease my complaint;
verses.ct: When I tell myself, 'My bed will bring me comfort; lying down will ease my suffering,'

verses.kjv: Then thou scarest me with dreams, and terrifiest me through visions:
verses.ct: then you terrify me with dreams and frighten me with visions.

verses.kjv: So that my soul chooseth strangling, and death rather than my life.
verses.ct: I would rather be strangled — I'd choose death over this body of mine.

verses.kjv: I loathe it; I would not live alway: let me alone; for my days are vanity.
verses.ct: I despise my life! I don't want to live forever. Leave me alone, because my days are meaningless.

verses.kjv: What is man, that thou shouldest magnify him? and that thou shouldest set thine heart upon him?
verses.ct: What are human beings that you make so much of them, that you focus your attention on them,

verses.kjv: And that thou shouldest visit him every morning, and try him every moment?
verses.ct: that you examine them every single morning and test them every moment?

verses.kjv: How long wilt thou not depart from me, nor let me alone till I swallow down my spittle?
verses.ct: How long until you look away from me? Will you not even give me time to swallow my own spit?

verses.kjv: I have sinned; what shall I do unto thee, O thou preserver of men? why hast thou set me as a mark against thee, so that I am a burden to myself?
verses.ct: If I have sinned, what have I done to you, O watcher of humanity? Why have you made me your target, so that I've become a burden even to myself?

verses.kjv: And why dost thou not pardon my transgression, and take away mine iniquity? for now shall I sleep in the dust; and thou shalt seek me in the morning, but I shall not be.
verses.ct: Why don't you forgive my wrongdoing and take away my guilt? Soon I'll lie down in the dust, and when you look for me in the morning, I'll be gone.
